item.title: 2016-02-13 - Compliment on Police Officer of New Territories North Region
item.content:

item.title: 2016-02-13 - Compliment on Police Officer of Tseung Kwan O Division
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
I write to express my sincere gratitude and appreciation to three Police officers for their professional attitude and proactive assistance provided regarding a noise complaint case lodged against my neighbour.
Upon my report to the Police (via calling 999) about suspected noise nuisance around midnight on 9th February 2016, the officers paid visit to my residence quickly and conducted thorough and effective investigation of the case, followed by prompt action (that was, to friendly remind the complained flat not to play musical instruments after 11:00 p.m. based on the Cap.400 regulations on noise nuisance). It was a very impressive experience as they communicated with all stakeholders and were also willing to solve the case by paying extra effort (that was, to communicate with us before, during and also after the case).
The case was eventually solved to everyone’s satisfaction after their practical communication with my neighbour. My family was of no doubt contented, if not marveled, by their comprehensive delivery of Police service. It is indeed fair to comment that the team of three officers had not only solved a minor residence case but also promoted a positive image of the Police to the general public. We have taken the privilege to share such pleasing experience to many of our friends and fellows.
To encourage and enhance the excellent performance of the Police Force, it will be most grateful if your relevant officers would thus receive relevant commendations for their silent yet industrious work done, which is believed to be seen across many cases including mine. Thanks to your wise management and team work, I am confident that there will be more appreciation reports from citizens in near future.
Yours faithfully Mr. LO
Note : One of the officers praised in this letter is PC 859 CHIN Siu-sun of Patrol Sub-unit 3, Tseung Kwan O Division.

item.title: 2016-02-07 – Compliment on Police Officer of Railway District
item.content:
I clumsily left my luggage in a taxi. Rushing to catch a flight leaving in 3 hours, I tried frantically to contact the taxi company. They were not responsive for about an hour. Failing which I went to the police post at IFC to make a report. Very quickly, the police officers on duty offered a solution. They were kind, efficient, and understanding. Their helpfulness and experience were vital in locating the taxi owner and eventually the driver. By this time there was a change in the reporting officers who were equally brilliant.
I managed to meet the driver and eventually collected my luggage. Everything was in tact and I rushed to the airport. Though I missed my flight and had to be on standby for the next 5 hours, the entire experience made me appreciate what the HK Police can do for HK.
Officer LUK followed up with a call and that was super! I am now enjoying my time with my family for the Lunar New Year. I would like to sincerely thank the officers for their excellent service and effective assistance. Finally, wishing them a prosperous and wonderful start to the Lunar New Year.
Mr. LAI
Note : Two of the officers praised in this letter are SPC 47759 LEUNG Kin-kwok and PC 1681 LUK Tat-hung of Lantau Airport Railway, Railway District

item.title: 2015-12-16 - Compliment of Police Officers of Mong Kok District

Most sincere regards, FOK

Connie

item.title: 2015-11-16 - Compliment on Police Officers of Wan Chai Division
item.content:
Dear Sir,
At a midnight of November 2015, I waited for several minutes at the reception hall of Wan Chai Police Station but the wait was really worth it. My case is not a complicated one but rather the opposite - a very simple. And this is the third reported case made for the same 'missing person' - my husband who is suffering from dementia. The first case was when he got lost whilst under the care of the Pamela Youde Hospital (he was lost in Chai Wan and was picked up in Central); the second was when he got lost by my maid (he was lost in Shau Kei Wan and was picked up in Wan Chai); and today was when he missed by his friends at a lunch gathering (he was lost in between Wan Chai and Causeway Bay and found IN Causeway Bay).
He had gone to the washroom and soon lost his presence of mind and found himself wandering out of the restaurant to the streets. The officers were very patient and thorough; they went to all the areas concerned; they talked to all the necessary parties familiar to him; and they talked to the caretakers of all the former places that he had stayed; and in the early evening (same day) they were able to locate him. I didn't have the chance to thank the police in the past and didn’t witness how diligent they are in the cases. Today I saw all that, they took me along in the police van till we finally picked him up and signed close the file.
I am very confident in the services, efficiency and capabilities of the Hong Kong police force (even in small matters) and I hope that in writing this, this would give them the needed initiative to keep up the good work.
Kindly extend my thanks, gratefulness and appreciation to these fine officers.
Yours sincerely, Veronica

item.title: 2015-11-12 - Compliment on Police Officers of Counter Terrorism and Internal Security Division
item.content:
Dear Sir,
I am writing to thank your colleagues, Station Sergeant LEE, Police Constable 1221 and Police Constable 11611 for your assistance.
My friend and I traveled from Melbourne, Australia, arriving at Hong Kong Airport on 1st October at approximately 10.30pm. We were looking for a Taxi to take us to a hotel in Kowloon.

Best Regards, Maree
Note : the officers praised in this letter are Station Sergeant LEE Wing-shum, PC 1221 LEUNG Wai-ho and PC 11611 HUNG Tung-man of Counter Terrorism Response Unit, Counter Terrorism and Internal Security Division

item.title: 2015-11-06 - Compliment on Police Officer of Airport District
item.content:

This is a compliment letter to show my appreciation to two police offers for their professionalism and dedication to help me to find my cell phone back.
I visited HK in September 2015 and lost my cell phone on the cab. I called the police and those two officers showed up and helped me all the way to find the taxi driver and my cell phone.
I would like to show my warmest appreciation for their help and I feel very safe and being taken care of with such great police team around. Thank You !
Best Regards, Mr HAO
Note : the officers praised in this letter are PC 33988 LAU Hing-cheung and 52847 WONG Nam-tat of Patrol Sub-unit 2, Airport District

item.title: 2015-11-05 - Compliment on Police Officers of Tseung Kwan O Division
item.content:
Dear Sir,
There was a case of 2 persons got drunken at a midnight on 1st November 2015, lingering at Yau Yue Wan Village, Tseung Kwan O.
Sorry for causing trouble meanwhile. One of my family members got drunken and fell on the ground. He just could not wake up and went home while I was also drunk as well.
Thanks for the police officers attending this case. They were really helpful, going out of their way and sending him home. This may not be their duty but they made such an effort to help, much appreciated!
Regards, Mr Chan

item.title: 2015-11-03 - Compliment on Police Officer of Happy Valley Division
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
I would like to send a letter to thank a police officer (Mr. Yuen) of Happy Valley Police Station. He was on duty at report room in a morning of October 2015 when I reported the loss of my mobile phone.
It was an intensely stressful experience for me as I have stored all seven years of my kids' photos since birth and they were not backed up.
Mr. Yuen was patient, calm and understanding in alleviating my concerns, efficient in explaining the situation and dutifully recorded my report with patience and efficiency.
Honestly, to me losing the mobile phone maybe a big thing personally but to the police, it's one of a million important things to handle but he nonetheless exhibited professionalism, courtesy and was very effective. More often than not I see members of the public not appreciating the great effort of HK Police Force and it is so unfair.
Mr. Yuen managed to track, trace and find my phone within 2 hours. You can imagine my surprise and gratitude. He also took care to follow up to ensure that I did get it back from the taxi driver who called the Happy Valley Police Station and admitted he found the phone stuck in the creaks of the taxi door.
I believe it is only right that his superiors or police office in charge in Happy Valley Police Station know of his good action. Mr. Yuen was very humble and claimed that he was only performing his duty, I do hope that this letter will serve as a reminder to the public that we are lucky to have such good Police Force and officers like Mr. Yuen in HK to help, support, serve and protect us.
It is only in the little things that we feel the Police Care !
Thank you again.
Regards, Marina
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 54345 YUEN Ka-chun of Patrol Sub-unit 4, Happy Valley Division

item.title: 2015-10-30 - Compliment on Police Officer of Airport District
item.content:
I lost a luggage on taxi on the way to airport and reported to a police officer of Airport Police Station. Mr. CHENG of Airport Police Station was very responsive and went out of his way to help me. He has good working attitude and professionalism. Hong Kong has good legal and social system and Hong Kong Police has high integrity. We support you and hope you will continue to keep Hong Kong in good order. Special thanks to Mr. CHENG and Hong Kong Police!
Amanda
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 33799 CHENG Kwun-wa of Patrol Sub-unit 3, Airport District

item.title: 2015-10-29 - Compliment on Police Officers of Central District
item.content:
Dear Sir,
I want to thank the police officers of Central Police Station who helped me out at the night of October 2015. I forgot to take note of the car plate of the vehicle and the number of the police officers so I could not identify them.
I boarded a taxi at Bonham Road and the taxi driver refused to take me to Mongkok as he was unwilling to cross the harbour at that time. I told the taxi driver he should either take me the destination or to the nearest police station. Upon hearing so, he called for assistance and asked the police to come. The police officers arrived promptly and they had pleasant and helpful attitude. They handled the complaint in the most professional manner and took record of the complaint. They also explained the rules to the driver and that he indeed has no ground to refuse the journey.
I am writing to thank the officers for handling the complaint in the most helpful, positive and professional manner. I should be grateful if you could kindly covey my thanks to them. Thank you.
Best Regards, Angie

item.title: 2015-10-23 - Compliment on Police Officer of Pat Heung Division
item.content:
I would like to show my appreciation to an Auxiliary Sergeant of Pat Heung Division. He is very responsive and polite. He coordinated the traffic at the entrance of Milk Farm, Tai Mo Shan effectively and professionally in an afternoon of October 2015. I have a very good impression on Hong Kong Police !
Kiko
Note : the officer praised in this letter is Auxiliary Sergeant 6817 LAU Yip-hung of Patrol Sub-unit 3, Pat Heung Division

item.title: 2015-10-20 - Compliment on Police Officers of Traffic Kowloon West Region
item.content:

On 6 September 2015, my motorcycle had some problem while I was driving home in the No. 5 highway form Kowloon to Hong Kong. As a result, my bike was unable to move in the highway as the back wheel was stuck. Three Police officers were very helpful. They provided some tools to me, and also helped me to remove that fabric. Note : the officers praised in this letter are Sergeant 52401 WONG Chi-keung, PC 34340 WONG King-fai and PC 11062 Man Ka-hing of Enforcement and Control Division, Kowloon West Region

item.title: 2015-10-15 - Compliment on Police Officer of Yau Tsim District
item.content:
Dear Sir / Madam,
On a day of October 2015, I approached Tsim Sha Tsui Police Station for accompanying my wife to provide the information of a suspected deception and theft case.
Throughout the process of information collection and statement taking, we did witness the professionalism of Madam CHAN in comprehension of complicated ideas by active listening to the victims with patience and sincere caring, and her high organization powers in presenting the accurate essential elements of information for follow up so as to uphold the justice in a highly professional manner.
We know the bitterness in handling public with ever-rising demand and unreasonable feedback to disciplined force in certain recent social scenarios, we see that there is a need to recognize the good deed and performance of frontline officers rather than only echoing discontent.
The senior management of her should be proud of having such a valuable asset under his command and we also thank her for her management in training the frontline to be of such high standard.
Please relay our deepest gratitude to Madam CHAN and her management, the team or her should be formally recognized to show the citizen's support and positive feedback to the police.
Best Reagrds, Mr. KWONG
Note : the officer praised in this letter is WPC 10921 CHAN Ho-hing of District Investigation Team 3 of Yau Tsim District

item.title: 2015-10-14 - Compliment on Police Officer of Wan Chai Division and Happy Valley Division
item.content:

I would like to applause the officers for checking all floors of my friend's residential building, just to make sure he was on the roof top, and later taking me around in the police van to look for him. item.title: 2015-10-05 - Compliment on Police Officers of Peak Sub-Division
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
I would like to express my thanks for the top class service and support provided by each officer who assisted me on the evening of Tuesday 29th September 2015. A young lady had become lost that evening whilst hiking on the peak and her phone battery had run out. She could not find her way back to the Peak Tower and became distressed alone in the dark. With the assistance of your officers she made it home and they took the time to ensure she was safe and well.
All officers involved acted efficiently, professionally and with great care. A true asset to your service. Those directly involved were Police Officers of Patrol Sub-unit 4, Peak Sub-Division.
Other officers encountered that night were equally professional but I was unable to take all of their badge numbers. Thank you to all involved.
Best Regards, Jonathan

item.title: 2015-10-05 - Compliment on Police Officer of Western Division
item.content:
Dear HK Police,
I would like to say thank you to the policeman, whom I did not manage to get his name recently.
It was around noon time on 2015-09-26 when I drove to Hill Road for lunch. There was a big lorry parking illegally ahead for offloading furniture. I was unable to park my car behind as it blocked the path but they were so rude and refused to move forward to let my car in. I was nervous and insulted by them. When I was worried about what to do, a policeman came to ask me if there was any traffic accident. I told the policeman about my concern and issue. He was so helpful to get those people to move out and teach me how to park my car. He was like a hero to me that time as I was relieved.
I truly and entirely appreciate his help and may I offer a salute to all of you.
Yours sincerely, Jenny

item.title: 2015-09-27 - Compliment on Police Officer of Tsing Yi Division
item.content:
Dear Sir,
I am writing to express my appreciation to two police officers of Tsing Yi Police Station for their professional and mindful action in recovering my lost mobile phone at Tsing Yi area.
In an evening of September 2015, when I arrived home after having dinner in a shopping center of Tsing Yi, I discovered my mobile phone was left behind in the toilet of the shopping mall. I immediately phoned the Security Office of mentioned shopping center requesting their assistance. However, the slow action and negative attitude of the officer discouraged my hope of recovering the phone. As the phone contained important personal information and some memorable photos, I needed to find it badly. I had no alternative but to seek assistance from Tsing Yi Police Station. With the concerted effort of two police officers, my mobile phone was found less than an hour after I reported to the duty officer of Tsing Yi Police Station.
I was really astonished by the efficiency of the officers. Their positive attitude to ease the worry of citizens should be highly recognized.
Yours sincerely, Lydia
Note : the officers praised in this letter are Sergeant 54110 CHAN Man-cheung and PC 15883 WONG Ka-ho of Patrol Sub-unit 4, Tsing Yi Division

item.title: 2015-09-15 - Compliment on Police Officer of Emergency Unit, Hong Kong Island
item.content:
Dear HK Police,
I would like to say thank you to the policemen - 港島衝鋒隊, PC 6571, PC 11126 and WPC 321. They are very helpful when I reported my apartment being locked inside this evening. When I came home this evening and I found out that my home being locked inside and suspected being broken in by somebody. I reported to my house management team and they helped me to report to the police. The policemen came quickly for investigation. It seemed that the door lock was locked accidentally. They are very polite, and tried to make sure my apartment is ok. Finally the door was opened by the goldsmith and my home is safe and fine. I would like to appreciate the quick response of the HK Police and their professionalism in dealing with such a simple case. Salute to all of you. Thanks.
Yours sincerely, Wong

item.title: 2015-09-10 - Compliment on Police Officer of Kowloon City District
item.content:
I really appreciate the police officers near my child's kindergarten situated at Cumberland Road every morning in the past few days. There have been fewer vehicles parked on the pavement which caused obstruction to pedestrian. I find the area safer for my child when we walk to school. I am also thankful for the fines given to the people who keep their cars idling while waiting. This action makes the area less polluted. Thank you.
Ms Mamta

item.title: 2015-09-06 - Compliment on Police Officers of Central District
item.content:

Monica Cheung

item.title: 2015-09-03 - Compliment on Police Officers of Tsuen Wan District
item.content:
Dear Sir,
In a morning of August 2015, I walked along a water trail near Ting Kau, Tsuen Wan and found a porcupine that had fallen into the water work channel and could not get out from it.
Then I phoned the police. Afterwards, police officers of Tsuen Wan Police Station came with Fire Service Department within short time. After considerable effort, they saved the animal and sent it to SPCA.
I'd like to thank the officers of Tseun Wan Police Station for their professional and courteous assistance. I feel sorry that I did not note the officers’ names but please pass my appreciation to your staff. Thank You!
Kind Regards, Mr. Horvath

item.title: 2015-08-28 - Compliment on Police Officer of Traffic Kowloon East Region
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
Recently I was pulled over and booked by a policeman for speeding at Clear Water Bay Road, Kowloon. This was my first traffic infringement in the past 11 years since I have lived here. He was so polite but fair and friendly, restoring my faith that there is nice policeman out in the community. Thank you!
Best Regards, Helen

item.title: 2015-08-26 - Compliment on Police Officer of North Point Division
item.content:

I witnessed a Madam (Madam Cheng) and her team (including 2 male police officers) making great effort in maintaining good order and safety of the lane. Mr Tsoi

item.title: 2015-08-24 - Compliment on Police Officer of Kwai Chung Division
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
I am writing to express my deep appreciation for the helpful attitude of the policeman who had provided good support and assistance to me and my family members when we were facing sudden death of our mother in late July.
Having noticed my mother sudden coma and death, we were so worried and distressed at that time. Fortunately, we had been given a lot help from the responsible policeman in the hospital and at the mortuary. Hence, we were strongly impressed by the helpful attitude of him and we would like to say thank you to him for his kindness and good support to us.
Best Regards, Alain
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 58329 WONG Io-cheong of Patrol Sub-unit 4, Kwai Chung Division.

item.title: 2015-08-24 - Compliment on Police Officer of Happy Valley Division
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
I am writing to express my sincerest thanks to two of your young officers serving in the Happy Valley Police Station. They went extraordinary lengths to contact me when a good citizen handed in my wallet after it slipped out from my pocket. What they would not have known is that I am due to fly overseas on holidays in the coming days which would have clearly been jeopardised with my HKID, bank cards etc.
The officers were outgoing, extremely helpful and they represented your organisation perfectly. It is all too easy as a member of the public to view workers from government departments with a certain degree of ambivalence. But when the staff showed such personality while committing to the responsibilities of the job it is memorable and I will hold the HK police in the highest regard as a result. My Sincerest thanks guys, you are doing an excellent job !
Yours sincerely, Jamie
Note : the officers praised in this letter are PC 18265 HO Ka-wai and PC 9945 LAW Chi-wai of Patrol Sub-unit 4, Happy Valley Division

item.title: 2015-08-17 - Compliment on Police Officer of Tseung Kwan O Division
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
In a morning of August 2015, I called the police in Tseung Kwan O Division and asked for help to connect with my sister. I live in USA and my sister (70 years old) lives in Tseung Kwan O by herself. I could not reach my sister for three weeks by calling her cell phone (she does not have a home phone). Every time when I called, it was said that the number was not registered. I did not know what happened to her and felt so worried about my sister’s safety. I made a lot of phone calls to different organizations in Hong Kong, but nobody could help me. Then I had no choice but to call the police. A female officer collected information over the phone, and coordinated between me and a male officer who found my sister. Finally I talked to my sister through the police officer’s cell phone. Without the help of the police officers, my sister would not notice that the phone company canceled her cell phone service.
My sister and I really appreciate the police officers' great help. I was so moved by these two police officers and their skills to handle international cases in such a professional and efficient way.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Best Regards, Ms LI

item.title: 2015-08-07 - Compliment on Police Officer of Wong Tai Sin District
item.content:
Dear Sir/Madam,
My elder sister was a victim in a deception case. After we reported the case to the police, two officers soon arrived at our home for assistance. I witnessed the high quality and high level of professionalism of the two officers, showing care, patience, and sympathy. They care about citizen's benefit first as they were willing to wait until my sister went to the bank to freeze her bank account and then gave us a ride to file a report at the station. Both my sister and myself felt touched, and after living in a few countries including HK, China and USA, I feel the urge to file this compliment to extend our gratitude to the two officers, who have exemplified a model of highest standard of work ethic and professionalism that is second to none of any of the police forces of the places I have lived before. I am proud to tell everyone that I am a HK citizen because HK has a police force like this.
Best Regards, Mr Fong
Note : the officers praised in this letter are PC 49003 LIU Hon-hung and PC 17004 TANG Hoi-san of Patrol Sub-unit 2, Wong Tai Sin District

item.title: 2015-07-25 - Compliment on Police Officer of Shatin Division
item.content:
At a midnight of July 2015, I called the police to ask for help as the soccer pitch at Sha Tin Area had all the lights on and it affected some buildings nearby. As a result, we couldn't fall asleep.
We called 999 and were then told that police officers would go for a check. To our delight, 30 minutes later, the lights were turned off.
We would like to send our appreciation to the officers that helped us in this matter efficiently.
Thank you.
Gloria

item.title: 2015-07-23 - Compliment on Police Officer of Ma On Shan Division
item.content:

Ms SHEK

item.title: 2015-07-08 - Compliment on Police Officer of Traffic New Territories South Region

Andrew

item.title: 2015-07-08 - Compliment on Police Officer of Airport District
item.content:
On a day of June 2015, we took a taxi from Harbour Grand Hotel in Hong Kong to Hong Kong International Airport. After we checked in, we realized that we had left one of our haversacks in the taxi.
We went to lodge a police report with regards to our lost property. CHEUNG Sir is the police officer who handled our case. Due to the limited time we had before boarding, his swift response was really helpful for us. He managed to track the car owner of the aforesaid taxi, and the owner later gave him the driver's number and managed to call the driver. CHEUNG Sir even went the extra mile to accompany us to the departure door to help us locate the driver.
If not him, we would have lost or would not be able to retrieve our laptop and other stuff in the haversack on time. We really appreciate his helpfulness and when we were desperate, he made it so much easier for us. We would like to express our gratitude towards him.
Miss NG
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 33222 CHEUNG Yau-hong of Patrol Sub-unit 4, Airport District

item.title: 2015-06-30 - Compliment on Police Officer of North Point Division
item.content:
To whom it may concern,
I would like to send my sincere appreciation to two police officers of North Point Police Station for their patience and professional attitude when resolving my dispute incident recently.
Thanks and best regards, Jimmy
Note : the officers praised in this letter are PC 16186 CHAN Chi-kit and PC 17681 TAI Tsz-ho of Patrol Sub-unit 4, North Point Division

item.title: 2015-06-28 - Compliment on Police Officer of Wan Chai District
item.content:
Dear Sir,
On a day of June 2015, my flatmate and I were home when the officers of District Special Duty Squad, Team 2 of Wan Chai Police Station came to collect evidence and arrest the women next door who had been running a brothel in the apartment directly next door to us. The whole situation was handled very professionally and the officers we spoke to were very polite and kind in taking time to explain what was happening next door. The entire operation ran very smoothly considering the media attention outside our building. We really appreciate the actions being taken and the manner in which it was carried out as it has been very difficult to live next door to such an establishment.
Resident of Wan Chai

item.title: 2015-06-27 - Compliment on Police Officer of Hung Hom Division
item.content:

Best Regards, Mr Mak
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 14125 WONG Hon-chiu of Patrol Sub-unit 2, Hung Hom Division

item.title: 2015-06-24 - Compliment on Police Officer of Traffic New Territories North Region
item.content:
Dear Sir / Madam,
I am writing to commend your officer from NTN Traffic Team, Mr. Cheung for his courteous and professional approach to handle my case.
We filed a report to Yuen Long Police Station over a “hit and run” involving our village property on a day of June, 2015 and your officer Mr. Cheung responded and arrived at our village shortly the same day.
Mr. Cheung, as one of the officers arrived at the scene, communicated with us in a very professional and polite manner while we were checking the CCTV footages together. He patiently and clearly explained the procedures to us step by step. More importantly, he showed his attention by listening carefully to our enquiries, and answered well. That made the whole investigation extremely smooth and efficient, and I must say our villagers are very much impressed.
With the great assistance provided by the police, we managed to contact the driver who is responsible for the damage property, and settled the case without much hassle.
However, such good work by Mr. Cheung should not be gone unnoticed, and I would like to take this opportunity to express my gratitude to the Police Force on this case, and also I would like to give my compliment to Mr. Cheung and his unit commander who must have good leadership to have such exemplary officer.
A job very well done, thank you !
Yours Faithfully,
William
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 9060 CHEUNG Lu-yi of Traffic Accident Investigation Team 1, New Territories North Region

item.title: 2015-06-18 - Compliment on Police Officers of Wong Tai Sin District
item.content:
Dear Sir / Madam,
First of all I would like to show my appreciation on the quick response of your officers in dealing with a traffic obstruction case at Ngau Chi Wan area in a morning of June 2015. I have sent an e-report via web and got a call from one of your officers within some time. Yet I don't know whether the concerned car had left the scene or not but I really appreciated your officers' quick response.
Meanwhile, I admired the effort the Police Force had made so as to maintain HK as a safe place to live. You all really deserve a big clap from us.
Yours faithfully, Ms Tang

item.title: 2015-06-12 - Compliment on Police Officers of Tai Po District
item.content:
Dear Sirs / Madams,
I would like to express my gratitude to Sheung Shui Division uniformed police officers and all CID officers of Team 8 Tai Po District for their professionalism, courteousness, patience and efficiency during a recent investigation of my theft of bicycle case.
Those uniformed police officers from Sheung Shui Division arrived promptly and took time to listen carefully, investigated and noted the details of the case. They explained to me what I have to do and answered all my queries. They are very helpful, patient and supportive. Then, those Team 8 CID officers from Tai Po District did the same job according to the procedure.
A few days later, I found my bicycle at Chi Yin Lane, Sheung Shui. Those uniformed police officers and CID officers arrived immediately and helped to keep a watchful eye on the bicycle, hopefully to arrest the thief. They showed their great responsibility and accountability by staying then and there in order to keep my stolen bicycle under in a safe status.
The excellent service provided by those police officers also reflects the professional leadership leading to the high quality service of the HK Police Force. Please help me to pass my sincere thanks to all of the police officers involved in my case. Their performance is superb, thank you !
Best Regards, Mr Chong

item.title: 2015-06-02 - Compliment on Police Officer of Traffic New Territories North Region
item.content:
Dear Sir,
I write to express my sincere thanks to a traffic police officer who has rendered his help to me this morning.
I was on my way to work and was stuck in a traffic jam outside the Fanling public swimming pool on San Wan Road of Sheung Shui, at about 7am today.
About 10 minutes later, a young male police officer approached me and told me that a taxi had an accident in the road ahead and it would take quite a while to move it out, clear the mess and resume normal traffic flow. He asked if I could turn my car up to a road divider so that I could make a u turn and head off. I said I could try but I am not very good in reversing the car, so I asked if he could help me to do so, and to my delight, he agreed and hopped in and did a beautiful job, as he got out of the car, he also reminded me to set the car seat position (as he had to move the car seat back to fit in) before I drive off.
I cannot express enough of my heartfelt gratitude to this officer who had been most helpful and friendly, and gone out of his way to help me. He could have ignored me and let me sit there in the car for hours. Please pass on my appreciation to him. Keep up with the good work !
Best regards, Miss Luk
Note : the officer praised in this letter is PC 8739 YEUNG Chak-ming of Enforcement and Control Division, New Territories North Traffic Patrol Sub-unit 1

item.title: 2015-05-30 - Compliment on Police Officer of Central District
item.content:
Dear Sir/ Madam,
I am writing to express my sincere appreciation and heartfelt gratitude to a police officer of Central Police Station. On a day of May 2015, at Central Harbourfront Event Space, my sister and I were involved in an Internet crime. We had brought Cavalia tickets online. We were deceived with the price difference at $800 with no possible solution or compensation from Cavalia. We could not go to the show since the tickets were not at the correct price and did not belong to us.
We reported the case to the police through 999. A police officer of Central District came with a helpful and friendly manner. He easily understood the situation with active listening skills and swiftly handled the matter. He patiently explained the reasons why Cavalia would not offer the compensation or difficulties in solving the case. Despite the above, he tended to deal the case with empathy and innate kindness. He tried to contact different sources for help. At last, with the constant and effective negotiation, he relayed our situation to the box office manager and solved the problem for us. Cavalia kindly offered us tickets on the following date. We did not expect that we would be treated with such a great help from the policeman. We were extremely thankful to him.
In the whole process, your staff showed high degree of professionalism, kindness and effectiveness. He is a young policeman with good heart, sound manner and mediation skills. I hope that through this letter, his work will be highly recognized and respected since his great effort in maintaining or uplifting the honors of the Police Force. It is hoped that his attitudes, conducts and skills will make him one of the most honorable policemen in the Force.
Yours faithfully, Miss Wong

item.title: 2015-05-28 - Compliment on Police Officers of Hung Hom Division
item.content:
Dear Sir,
This is a letter of praise for the police officers who responded to an incident in Hung Hom area which occurred on a day in May 2015, involving the loss of my designer label change bag that I dropped at a the curb where my car was parked while offloading some groceries.
Upon arriving at the scene, police officers of Hung Hom Police Station immediately took down the details of the missing change bag and persuaded the security guards to review CCTV footage taken of the surrounding area where the change bag was allegedly lost.
Upon review of the CCTV footage, it was quickly identified that the perpetrator was in fact a tenant staying in the building. With assistance from the police officers, the perpetrator, a Mongolian male, was immediately accosted while he came out for walk. The police officers then requested to attend his flat and show them the change bag found outside the building containing all of my personal data and most importantly, a highly confidential memory stick.
Although the perpetrator was not arrested at the time, it is unlikely I would have recovered the lost change bag without the efforts of the abovementioned police officers. They are a credit to the Hong Kong Police Force, literally a needle found in a haystack. I am happy to provide a statement as needed if the matter is taken any further, and would like to thank these police officers for taking my request at face value, and achieving an equally efficient and unbelievably positive result!
Yours sincerely, Keith

item.title: 2015-04-07 - Compliment on Police Officer of Tsuen Wan District

Patiently explaining to me on the one hand as to how to drive back to the car parks nearby, the young policeman carefully assisted my mother to get off and leave the road ensuring the safety of this old lady while easing my tension at the same time.
For a policeman who had been standing under the sun for some time to maintain the order and who might have come across difficult visitors, this policeman remained polite and sincere demonstrating his respect and passion for his own profession
I trust that this policeman is not an exception and I am confident that our policemen in general can truly live up to the name of the Hong Kong Police Force to protect Hong Kong people in every possible way.
Thank You!
Bonnie Tang

item.title: 2015-03-10 - Compliment on Police Officers of Wan Chai Division
item.content:

I am also deeply impressed by the fact that the male uniform officer took his initiative to try to locate the suspects in the surrounding areas and within a very short period of time, he was able to apprehend the two ladies who had apparently taken my belongings.
To sum up, I found both the uniform officers and crime unit officers involved in my case to be very well-trained, well-supervised, and dedicated. item.title: 2015-03-06 - Compliment on Police Officers of Tai Po Division
item.content:

This male was making serious sexual harassment phone calls to female employees with an unknown number in HK. This male boarded a direct flight from HK to Toronto in 2014 and showed up at our offices. He was later arrested and deported by Canadian authorities, but he continued the nuisance calls after his deportation which prompted me to contact the HK Police. I had little to offer in regards to information on how to locate this male in HK. Chief Inspector William HO of Tai Po Police Station kept me informed which made the female staff in the office more relaxed knowing that someone was taking care of the situation in HK where the suspect was living. I'm pretty sure the Chief Inspector’s workload was substantial and this incident would be down on his to do list. I appreciate his enthusiasm / customer service in not only serving the citizens of HK but also the citizens of another country. As a result of Chief Inspector HO's actions, you now have almost 400 staff members at our head office in Canada with a positive view of the HK Police Force. Chief Inspector HO should be commended for going that extra mile in helping us. As for Inspector Sophia CHEUNG, I appreciate the follow-up emails finalizing the issue for now, but leaving the door open in case the issue reappears down the road. On behalf of our company and myself, I would appreciate it if you would pass on our thanks from Canada to them.
Best Regards, Robert
Note : the officers praised in this letter are retired Chief Inspector HO Siu-ting, William and Woman Inspector CHEUNG Kwan-ting, Sophia of Tai Po District

They have not just done a commendable job but have also reinforced my positive impression of the Police Force. For that, I would like to once again express my sincere appreciation.

item.title: 2015-01-28 - Compliments on Police Officers of Wan Chai Division

item.title: 2014-12-16 - Compliment on Hong Kong Police Force
item.content:
Dear Sirs,
I write to express my gratitude to the Hong Kong Police Force for their efforts in handling the situation over the past two and a half months in the HKSAR. The city experienced a very dangerous scenario where legal enforcement had been challenged and various public orders had been disregarded. Being a member of the public, I was very anxious to see one of the fundamentals of our SAR that made us proud, the legal system, had been severely defied by some unlawful attempts. Also, the livelihood and daily life of the majority of the public had been considerably affected by the illegal actions of some radicals such as blockage of main roads over such a prolonged period.
It was the Police Force that had displayed ultimate tolerance to provocations and outrageous actions, and managed to keep the situation under control. Throughout several effective operations, the order of those unrest areas has been restored one after another and the traffic has resumed to its original state. Not all of the operations were flawless, yet the public could see the professionalism displayed by the Force aiming to minimize any possible casualty involving any member of the public. These have been proven to be successful and gladly the interests of the public have been well protected, and more importantly, law and order in Hong Kong have been restored.
I understand that throughout the difficult time the Police Force had been suffering from a lot both physically and mentally, in additional to the impact on the overall morale. However, I am glad to see that all these did not affect the Force when performing their duties. They are still one of the most efficient and professional services in the world. Honestly, it would be hard to imagine how the situation would become without the decisive enforcement by the Force during this period.
At last, I would like to give my appreciation again to the Hong Kong Police Force, which they deserved, for all their efforts and dedications that have made Hong Kong one of the safest cities in the globe.
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,
Mr. Wan

item.title: 2014-12-02 - Compliment on Hong Kong Police Force
item.content:
To everyone of the Hong Kong Police Force,
I know this letter might not mean a lot, but I just want to thank everyone of the Hong Kong Police Force for staying professional and sticking to your posts to keep our lives and properties safe and sound throughout this turmoil.
I just want to let you know that there are many, many people in Hong Kong who are 200% supportive of your effort in trying to restore the order in this city. Hong Kong is currently suffering from a political war with different stakeholders trying to fool the public for their own gain.
In the incident of using tear gas, no matter what we saw on the television, what we learnt from the rumors spread on the internet, or even from those who claimed that they were at the scenes, no one on this earth will be able to see "everything" and knowing "all the facts" in such a chaotic situation. There have been plenty, and will have even more criticisms by the Occupy Central participants, politicians or different stakeholders against the HKPF on the media. We need the HKPF to be here to ensure the order of the society to be restored. Without your professionalism and endurance, we will lose this place that all of us have built throughout these years in the blink of the eyes.
A lot of us know and can imagine what each of you is going through physically, psychologically, mentally and spiritually throughout this ordeal. Believe me, there are plenty of us who are extremely grateful that all of you are sticking to your posts, and we truly wish we could do more.
Once again, I just want to say that we are grateful and we are indebted to all of you for being able to live in an orderly environment. Please do not give up. We have your back as you have ours.
Woods

item.content:

Thank you for standing in the rain, under the sun or clouds in the past days. Thank you for protecting both the protestors and the anti-protestors. Thank you for making sure that I can cross the streets safely. Thank you for remaining professional. Thank you for being patient. Thank you for setting an example of orderly conduct. Thank you for putting your own opinions aside but our safety first. Thank you for staying with the people even when you are thinking of your family at home. Thank you for not giving inappropriate remarks. Thank you for not taking the protest personal against your work. Thank you for your sweat, toil, tears, or even blood. Thank you to your family for their sacrifice.
Keep up the good work.
Best Regards,
Jeff

item.content:

The Occupy Central Movement make me very worried about the future of HK and deep in my heart I know without Hong Kong Police’s presence, the situations will deteriorate really quick.
The recent clashes between the so-called ‘freedom fighters’ and the HK Police have really triggered my nerve. I feel sorry for the Police in Hong Kong being put under such a huge duress. I take my hat off to your professionalism and tolerance towards some of the unruly mobs.
Some of the so-called ‘freedom fighters’ assert themselves as non-violent and peace loving groups, but they are none of these at all. They employ psychological violence of abusive language and condescending indifference to challenge your patience and tolerance. They wear you out both physically and mentally with their guerrilla warfare tactics. These unruly mobs know full well that you cannot react to their senseless behaviours because you are wearing the uniform of the Hong Kong Police. I despise these unruly mobs.
I give the Hong Kong Police my full support because I know you are the BEST POLICE FORCE in the world. No other Police Forces can be as patient, tolerant and professional as you are. I know every Hong Kong having migrated to Brisbane support Hong Kong Police unconditionally.
Regards,
Ms. LEUNG
